ARABIC: مُّسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ وَمَا هِىَ مِنَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ بِبَعِيدٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: piled on top of one another in layers, each one earmarked by your Lord. And they are never far from the wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Impressed with (the signs) of your Lord. And such (punishment) is not far for the (other) transgressers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: marked from your Lord. Nor is the punishment far off from the wrong-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: marked by your Lord. Such a punishment is not far away from the unjust people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: That are marked, in the custody your Lord; and those stones are not at all far from the unjust!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Marked from your Lord; and they are not ever far from the wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Marked (for punishment) with your Lord and it is not far off from the unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: marked with thy Lord, and never far from the evildoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Marked with fire in the providence of thy Lord (for the destruction of the wicked). And they are never far from the wrong-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: marked for them by the decree of your Lord. The punishment of the unjust was not far off.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Marked from before thy Lord. Nor are they from the wrong- doers far away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: sent in from your Lord [for the profligate], never far from the wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Marked as from thy Lord: Nor are they ever far from those who do wrong!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Marked from your Lord, and they are not ever far from the Zalimun (polytheists, evil-doers, etc.).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: marked with your Lord, and never far from the evildoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Marked from your Lord, and never far from the wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Marked from your Lord. And Allah 's punishment is not from the wrongdoers [very] far.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [11:83] marked, [each one of them] with the name of the person it would strike, with your Lord (‘inda rabbik is an adverbial qualifier for these [stones]), and they, the stones — or their lands — are not far from the evildoers, that is, [from] the people of Mecca.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Marked with fire) lined with black, red and white; it is also said that they had inscribed on them the names of persons they were destined to kill (in the providence of your Lord) those stones of clay were from your Lord, Muhammad. (And they) i.e. the stones (are never far from the wrong-doers) they did not miss them but rather hit them; it is also said that this means: these stones are never far from the wrong-doers, who 236 emulate their practice, from among your nation.
